content: 5 Acteth not unbecomingly､ Seeketh not her own things､ Is not easily provoked､ Imputeth not that which is base,
content_old: 5 Acteth not unbecomingly､ Seeketh not her own things､ Is not easily provoked､ Imputeth not that which is base,

content: 6 Rejoiceth not over unrighteousness､ But rejoiceth in sympathy with truth,—
content_old: 6 Rejoiceth not over unrighteousness､ But rejoiceth in sympathy with truth,—

content: 7 All things covereth､ All things believeth､ All things hopeth､ All things endureth.
content_old: 7 All things covereth､ All things believeth､ All things hopeth､ All things endureth.

content: 8 Love at no time faileth;— But whether prophesyings They shall be done away､ Whether tongues They shall cease, Whether gaining knowledge It shall be done away;
content_old: 8 Love at no time faileth;— But whether prophesyings They shall be done away､ Whether tongues They shall cease, Whether gaining knowledge It shall be done away;

content: 9 For in part are we gaining knowledge､ And in part are we prophesying,—
content_old: 9 For in part are we gaining knowledge､ And in part are we prophesying,—

content: 10 But as soon as that which is complete is come That which is in part shall be done away.
content_old: 10 But as soon as that which is complete is come That which is in part shall be done away.

content: 11 When I was a child I used to speak as a child､ To prefer as a child, To reason as a child: Now I have become a man I have laid aside the things of the child!
content_old: 11 When I was a child I used to speak as a child､ To prefer as a child, To reason as a child: Now I have become a man I have laid aside the things of the child!

content: 12 For we see､ as yet､ through a dim window obscurely, But then face to face: As yet I gain knowledge in part, But then shall I fully know､ Even as I was also fully known.
content_old: 12 For we see､ as yet､ through a dim window obscurely, But then face to face: As yet I gain knowledge in part, But then shall I fully know､ Even as I was also fully known.

content: 1 Pursue love; Nevertheless be envious of the spiritual gifts,— And rather that ye may be prophesying.
content_old: 1 Pursue love; Nevertheless be envious of the spiritual gifts,— And rather that ye may be prophesying.

content: 2 For he that speaketh with a tongue Not unto men doth speak､ but unto God,— For no one understandeth, Although in spirit he is speaking sacred secrets;
content_old: 2 For he that speaketh with a tongue Not unto men doth speak､ but unto God,— For no one understandeth, Although in spirit he is speaking sacred secrets;

content: 3 But he that prophesieth Unto men doth speak—edification､ and exhortation､ and comfort.
content_old: 3 But he that prophesieth Unto men doth speak—edification､ and exhortation､ and comfort.

content: 4 He that speaketh with a tongue Buildeth up himself, Whereas he that prophesieth Buildeth up an assembly.
content_old: 4 He that speaketh with a tongue Buildeth up himself, Whereas he that prophesieth Buildeth up an assembly.

content: 5 Howbeit I wish you all to speak with tongues, But rather that ye may prophesy,— Moreover greater is he that prophesieth､ Than he that speaketh with tongues,— Unless indeed he translate､ That the assembly may receive up-building.
content_old: 5 Howbeit I wish you all to speak with tongues, But rather that ye may prophesy,— Moreover greater is he that prophesieth､ Than he that speaketh with tongues,— Unless indeed he translate､ That the assembly may receive up-building.

content: 6 But now brethren— If I come unto you speaking with tongues What shall I profit you, Except I speak unto you､ either by way of revelation､ or knowledge､ or prophesying､ or teaching?
content_old: 6 But now brethren— If I come unto you speaking with tongues What shall I profit you, Except I speak unto you､ either by way of revelation､ or knowledge､ or prophesying､ or teaching?

content: 7 In like manner the things without life giving sound､ whether pipe or harp If a distinction in the sounds they do not give How shall it be known､ what is being piped or harped?
content_old: 7 In like manner the things without life giving sound､ whether pipe or harp If a distinction in the sounds they do not give How shall it be known､ what is being piped or harped?

content: 8 For if also an uncertain sound a trumpet should give Who shall prepare himself for battle?
content_old: 8 For if also an uncertain sound a trumpet should give Who shall prepare himself for battle?

content: 9 So also ye through means of the tongue Except ye give intelligible discourse How shall it be known what is being spoken? For ye will be speaking to the air.
content_old: 9 So also ye through means of the tongue Except ye give intelligible discourse How shall it be known what is being spoken? For ye will be speaking to the air.

content: 10 There may happen to be so many kinds of languages in the world, And not one unspoken:—
content_old: 10 There may happen to be so many kinds of languages in the world, And not one unspoken:—

content: 11 If､ then､ I do not know the meaning of the language I shall be､ unto him that is speaking､ a foreigner, And he that is speaking shall be in my case a foreigner.
content_old: 11 If､ then､ I do not know the meaning of the language I shall be､ unto him that is speaking､ a foreigner, And he that is speaking shall be in my case a foreigner.

content: 12 So ye also— Since ye are envious of spirits Unto the upbuilding of the assembly seek to be pre-eminent.
content_old: 12 So ye also— Since ye are envious of spirits Unto the upbuilding of the assembly seek to be pre-eminent.

content: 13 Wherefore he that speaketh with a tongue Let him pray that he may translate;
content_old: 13 Wherefore he that speaketh with a tongue Let him pray that he may translate;

content: 14 For if I am praying in a tongue My spirit is praying, But my mind is unfruitful.
content_old: 14 For if I am praying in a tongue My spirit is praying, But my mind is unfruitful.

content: 15 What is it then? I will pray with the spirit､ But I will pray also with the mind,— I will strike the strings with the spirit､ But I will strike the strings also with the mind.
content_old: 15 What is it then? I will pray with the spirit､ But I will pray also with the mind,— I will strike the strings with the spirit､ But I will strike the strings also with the mind.

content: 16 Else if thou be blessing in a spirit He that filleth up the place of the ungifted person How shall he say the Amen upon thy thanksgiving? Since indeed what thou art saying he knoweth not;
content_old: 16 Else if thou be blessing in a spirit He that filleth up the place of the ungifted person How shall he say the Amen upon thy thanksgiving? Since indeed what thou art saying he knoweth not;

content: 17 For thou indeed､ excellently art giving thanks, But the other is not being built up.
content_old: 17 For thou indeed､ excellently art giving thanks, But the other is not being built up.

content: 18 I give thanks unto God!— More than ye all am I speaking with tongues;
content_old: 18 I give thanks unto God!— More than ye all am I speaking with tongues;

content: 19 But in assembly I desire to speak five words with my mind That others also I may instruct Than myriads of words in a tongue.
content_old: 19 But in assembly I desire to speak five words with my mind That others also I may instruct Than myriads of words in a tongue.

content: 20 Brethren! do not become children in your understandings; But in baseness become babes, While in your understandings ye become full-grown､
content_old: 20 Brethren! do not become children in your understandings; But in baseness become babes, While in your understandings ye become full-grown､

content: 21 In the law it is written— With strange tongues､ And with lips of strangers Will I speak unto this people; And not even so will they hearken unto me,— Saith the Lord.
content_old: 21 In the law it is written— With strange tongues､ And with lips of strangers Will I speak unto this people; And not even so will they hearken unto me,— Saith the Lord.

content: 22 So that the tongues are for a sign— Not unto them that believe､ But unto them that believe not; Whereas prophesying is Not for them that believe not､ But for them that believe.
content_old: 22 So that the tongues are for a sign— Not unto them that believe､ But unto them that believe not; Whereas prophesying is Not for them that believe not､ But for them that believe.

content: 23 If､ then､ the whole assembly come together with one consent, And all are speaking with tongues,— And there come in persons unskilled or unbelieving Will they not say that ye are raving?
content_old: 23 If､ then､ the whole assembly come together with one consent, And all are speaking with tongues,— And there come in persons unskilled or unbelieving Will they not say that ye are raving?

content: 24 But if all be prophesying,— And there come in one who is unbelieving or unskilled He is convicted by all､ He is searched by all, The secrets of his heart become manifest;
content_old: 24 But if all be prophesying,— And there come in one who is unbelieving or unskilled He is convicted by all､ He is searched by all, The secrets of his heart become manifest;

content: 25 And so falling down upon his face he will do homage unto God, reporting that in reality God is among you.
content_old: 25 And so falling down upon his face he will do homage unto God, reporting that in reality God is among you.

content: 26 What､ then､ is it, brethren? Whensoever ye are coming together Each one hath a psalm､ hath a teaching､ hath a revelation､ hath a tongue､ hath a translation:— Let all things be done unto building up.
content_old: 26 What､ then､ is it, brethren? Whensoever ye are coming together Each one hath a psalm､ hath a teaching､ hath a revelation､ hath a tongue､ hath a translation:— Let all things be done unto building up.

content: 27 If with a tongue one is speaking Let it be by two, or､ at the most､ three,— And by turns; And let one be translating;
content_old: 27 If with a tongue one is speaking Let it be by two, or､ at the most､ three,— And by turns; And let one be translating;

content: 28 But if there be none to translate Let him keep silence in assembly, And unto himself be speaking, and unto God.
content_old: 28 But if there be none to translate Let him keep silence in assembly, And unto himself be speaking, and unto God.

content: 29 Prophets､ moreover Let two or three speak, And let the others judge.
content_old: 29 Prophets､ moreover Let two or three speak, And let the others judge.

content: 30 If､ however､ unto another a revelation be made as he is sitting Let the first be silent;
content_old: 30 If､ however､ unto another a revelation be made as he is sitting Let the first be silent;

content: 31 For one by one ye can all be prophesying,— That all may learn､ and all be encouraged.
content_old: 31 For one by one ye can all be prophesying,— That all may learn､ and all be encouraged.

content: 32 And spirits of prophets unto prophets do submit themselves;
content_old: 32 And spirits of prophets unto prophets do submit themselves;

content: 33 For God is not a God of confusion but of peace:— As in all the assemblies of the saints.
content_old: 33 For God is not a God of confusion but of peace:— As in all the assemblies of the saints.

content: 34 As for the women In the assemblies let them be silent, For it is not permitted them to be speaking; But let them be in submission,— Even as the law saith.
content_old: 34 As for the women In the assemblies let them be silent, For it is not permitted them to be speaking; But let them be in submission,— Even as the law saith.

content: 35 If､ however､ they are wishing to learn something At home their own husbands let them question; For it is a shame for a woman to be speaking in assembly.
content_old: 35 If､ however､ they are wishing to learn something At home their own husbands let them question; For it is a shame for a woman to be speaking in assembly.

content: 36 Or from you did the word of God come forth? Or unto you alone did it extend?
content_old: 36 Or from you did the word of God come forth? Or unto you alone did it extend?

content: 37 If anyone thinketh himself to be a prophet､ or spiritually gifted Let him acknowledge the things which I am writing to you,— That they are a commandment of the Lord.
content_old: 37 If anyone thinketh himself to be a prophet､ or spiritually gifted Let him acknowledge the things which I am writing to you,— That they are a commandment of the Lord.

content: 38 But if anyone knoweth not he is unknown!
content_old: 38 But if anyone knoweth not he is unknown!

content: 39 So､ then､ my brethren,— Be zealous to prophesy, And do not forbid to be speaking with tongues;
content_old: 39 So､ then､ my brethren,— Be zealous to prophesy, And do not forbid to be speaking with tongues;

content: 1 Moreover､ brethren､ I make known unto you､ The joyful message— Which I myself announced to you､ Which also ye received, In which also ye stand;
content_old: 1 Moreover､ brethren､ I make known unto you､ The joyful message— Which I myself announced to you､ Which also ye received, In which also ye stand;

content: 2 Through which also ye are being saved,— If ye hold fast With what discourse I announced the joyful message unto you;— Unless indeed in vain ye believed.
content_old: 2 Through which also ye are being saved,— If ye hold fast With what discourse I announced the joyful message unto you;— Unless indeed in vain ye believed.

content: 3 For I delivered unto you among the first things What also I received:— How that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,
content_old: 3 For I delivered unto you among the first things What also I received:— How that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,

content: 4 And that he was buried, And that he hath been raised､ on the third day, according to the Scriptures,—
content_old: 4 And that he was buried, And that he hath been raised､ on the third day, according to the Scriptures,—

content: 5 And that he appeared unto Cephas､ Then to the twelve,
content_old: 5 And that he appeared unto Cephas､ Then to the twelve,

content: 6 After that he appeared to above five hundred brethren at once,— Of whom the greater number remain until even now, But some have fallen asleep,—
content_old: 6 After that he appeared to above five hundred brethren at once,— Of whom the greater number remain until even now, But some have fallen asleep,—

content: 7 After that he appeared unto James, Then unto all the apostles,
content_old: 7 After that he appeared unto James, Then unto all the apostles,

content: 8 And last of all Just as if unto the unseasonable birth He appeared even unto me;
content_old: 8 And last of all Just as if unto the unseasonable birth He appeared even unto me;

content: 9 For I am the least of the apostles, Who am not worthy to be called an apostle､ Because I persecuted the assembly of God.
content_old: 9 For I am the least of the apostles, Who am not worthy to be called an apostle､ Because I persecuted the assembly of God.

content: 10 But by favour of God I am what I am, And his favour､ which was unto me hath not been made void,— But much more abundantly than they all have I toiled, Albeit not I､ but the favour of God with me.
content_old: 10 But by favour of God I am what I am, And his favour､ which was unto me hath not been made void,— But much more abundantly than they all have I toiled, Albeit not I､ but the favour of God with me.

content: 11 Whether therefore I or they Thus do we proclaim, And thus did ye believe.
content_old: 11 Whether therefore I or they Thus do we proclaim, And thus did ye believe.

content: 12 Now if Christ is proclaimed､ That from among the dead he hath been raised How say some among you— Resurrection of the dead there is none?
content_old: 12 Now if Christ is proclaimed､ That from among the dead he hath been raised How say some among you— Resurrection of the dead there is none?

content: 13 But if resurrection of the dead there is none Not even Christ hath been raised;
content_old: 13 But if resurrection of the dead there is none Not even Christ hath been raised;

content: 14 And if Christ hath not been raised Void､ after all is our proclamation, Void also our faith,—
content_old: 14 And if Christ hath not been raised Void､ after all is our proclamation, Void also our faith,—

content: 15 And we are found even false-witnesses of God, Because we have witnessed respecting God､ That he raised the Christ,— Whom he did not raise, If､ indeed､ after all The dead are not raised!
content_old: 15 And we are found even false-witnesses of God, Because we have witnessed respecting God､ That he raised the Christ,— Whom he did not raise, If､ indeed､ after all The dead are not raised!

content: 16 For if the dead are not raised Not even Christ hath been raised;
content_old: 16 For if the dead are not raised Not even Christ hath been raised;

content: 17 And if Christ hath not been raised To no purpose is your faith､ Yet are ye in your sins!
content_old: 17 And if Christ hath not been raised To no purpose is your faith､ Yet are ye in your sins!

content: 18 Hence also they who are fallen asleep in Christ are lost:
content_old: 18 Hence also they who are fallen asleep in Christ are lost:

content: 19 If in this life in Christ we have hoped—and that is all We are of all men most to be pitied.
content_old: 19 If in this life in Christ we have hoped—and that is all We are of all men most to be pitied.

content: 20 But now hath Christ been raised from among the dead,— A firstfruit of them who have fallen asleep;
content_old: 20 But now hath Christ been raised from among the dead,— A firstfruit of them who have fallen asleep;

content: 21 For since indeed through a man came death Through a man also cometh the raising of the dead;
content_old: 21 For since indeed through a man came death Through a man also cometh the raising of the dead;

content: 22 For just as in the Adam all die So also in the Christ shall all be made alive.
content_old: 22 For just as in the Adam all die So also in the Christ shall all be made alive.

content: 23 But each in his own rank:— A firstfruit Christ, After that they who are the Christ’s in his Presence,—
content_old: 23 But each in his own rank:— A firstfruit Christ, After that they who are the Christ’s in his Presence,—

content: 24 Afterwards the end— Whensoever he delivereth up the kingdom unto his God and Father, Whensoever he shall bring to nought all rule and all authority and power;
content_old: 24 Afterwards the end— Whensoever he delivereth up the kingdom unto his God and Father, Whensoever he shall bring to nought all rule and all authority and power;

content: 25 For he must needs reign､ until he shall put all his enemies under his feet:
content_old: 25 For he must needs reign､ until he shall put all his enemies under his feet:

content: 26 As a last enemy death is to be destroyed;
content_old: 26 As a last enemy death is to be destroyed;

content: 27 For— He put all things in subjection under his feet. But whensoever it shall be said— All things are in subjection!—— It is evident that it means,— Except him who did put into subjection unto him the All things——
content_old: 27 For— He put all things in subjection under his feet. But whensoever it shall be said— All things are in subjection!—— It is evident that it means,— Except him who did put into subjection unto him the All things——

content: 28 But whensoever have been put into subjection unto him the All things Then the Son himself also shall be put in subjection unto him who put in subjection unto him the All things,— That God may be all things in all.
content_old: 28 But whensoever have been put into subjection unto him the All things Then the Son himself also shall be put in subjection unto him who put in subjection unto him the All things,— That God may be all things in all.

content: 29 Else what will they do､ who are being immersed in behalf of the dead? If not at all are the dead to be raised Why are they even being immersed in their behalf?
content_old: 29 Else what will they do､ who are being immersed in behalf of the dead? If not at all are the dead to be raised Why are they even being immersed in their behalf?

content: 30 Why also are we running into peril every hour?
content_old: 30 Why also are we running into peril every hour?

content: 31 Day by day am I dying!— Yea! by your own boasting､ brethren, Which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord.
content_old: 31 Day by day am I dying!— Yea! by your own boasting､ brethren, Which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord.

content: 32 If after the manner of men I have fought with wild-beasts at Ephesus What to me the profit? If the dead are not raised Let us eat and drink, For to-morrow we die.
content_old: 32 If after the manner of men I have fought with wild-beasts at Ephesus What to me the profit? If the dead are not raised Let us eat and drink, For to-morrow we die.

content: 33 Be not deceiving yourselves,— Evil communications corrupt gentle manners:—
content_old: 33 Be not deceiving yourselves,— Evil communications corrupt gentle manners:—

content: 34 Wake up to sobriety in righteousness, And be not committing sin; For some have an ignorance of God: For shame､ unto you am I speaking!
content_old: 34 Wake up to sobriety in righteousness, And be not committing sin; For some have an ignorance of God: For shame､ unto you am I speaking!

content: 35 But some one will say— How are the dead raised? And with what kind of body do they come?
content_old: 35 But some one will say— How are the dead raised? And with what kind of body do they come?

content: 36 Simple one! What thou sowest is not quickened except it die;
content_old: 36 Simple one! What thou sowest is not quickened except it die;

content: 37 And what thou sowest Not the body that shall come into existence dost thou sow, But a naked kernel— If it so happen of wheat, or of any of the rest,—
content_old: 37 And what thou sowest Not the body that shall come into existence dost thou sow, But a naked kernel— If it so happen of wheat, or of any of the rest,—

content: 38 Howbeit God giveth it a body as he pleased, And unto each of the seeds a body of its own.
content_old: 38 Howbeit God giveth it a body as he pleased, And unto each of the seeds a body of its own.

content: 39 Not all flesh is the same flesh; But one indeed､ is the flesh of men And another the flesh of beasts､ And another the flesh of birds､ And another of fishes;
content_old: 39 Not all flesh is the same flesh; But one indeed､ is the flesh of men And another the flesh of beasts､ And another the flesh of birds､ And another of fishes;

content: 40 And there are heavenly bodies､ and earthly bodies,— But of one kind indeed､ is the glory of the heavenly, And of another kind is the glory of the earthly;—
content_old: 40 And there are heavenly bodies､ and earthly bodies,— But of one kind indeed､ is the glory of the heavenly, And of another kind is the glory of the earthly;—

content: 41 One is the glory of a sun､ And another the glory of a moon､ And another the glory of stars,— Nay! star from star differeth in glory.
content_old: 41 One is the glory of a sun､ And another the glory of a moon､ And another the glory of stars,— Nay! star from star differeth in glory.

content: 42 Thus also the resurrection of the dead: It is sown in corruption､ It is raised in incorruption,
content_old: 42 Thus also the resurrection of the dead: It is sown in corruption､ It is raised in incorruption,

content: 43 It is sown in dishonour､ It is raised in glory, It is sown in weakness､ It is raised in power,
content_old: 43 It is sown in dishonour､ It is raised in glory, It is sown in weakness､ It is raised in power,

content: 44 It is sown a body of the soul, It is raised a body of the spirit;— If there is a body of the soul There is also of the spirit:—
content_old: 44 It is sown a body of the soul, It is raised a body of the spirit;— If there is a body of the soul There is also of the spirit:—

content: 45 Thus also､ it is written— The first man､ Adam､ became a living soul, The last Adam a life-giving spirit.
content_old: 45 Thus also､ it is written— The first man､ Adam､ became a living soul, The last Adam a life-giving spirit.

content: 46 Howbeit not first is the body of the spirit, But that of the soul,— Afterwards that of the spirit.
content_old: 46 Howbeit not first is the body of the spirit, But that of the soul,— Afterwards that of the spirit.

content: 47 The first man is of the ground earthy,— The second man is of heaven:
content_old: 47 The first man is of the ground earthy,— The second man is of heaven:

content: 48 As the man of earth such also､ the men of earth, And as the man of heaven such also､ the men of heaven;
content_old: 48 As the man of earth such also､ the men of earth, And as the man of heaven such also､ the men of heaven;

content: 49 And even as we have borne the image of the man of earth Let us also bear the image of the man of heaven.
content_old: 49 And even as we have borne the image of the man of earth Let us also bear the image of the man of heaven.

content: 50 And this I say､ brethren,— That flesh and blood cannot inherit God’s kingdom. Neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.
content_old: 50 And this I say､ brethren,— That flesh and blood cannot inherit God’s kingdom. Neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.

content: 51 Lo! a sacred secret unto you do I declare:— We shall not all sleep, But we shall all be changed,—
content_old: 51 Lo! a sacred secret unto you do I declare:— We shall not all sleep, But we shall all be changed,—

content: 52 In a moment､ In the twinkling of an eye, During the last trumpet; For it shall sound, And the dead shall be raised incorruptible, And we shall be changed.
content_old: 52 In a moment､ In the twinkling of an eye, During the last trumpet; For it shall sound, And the dead shall be raised incorruptible, And we shall be changed.

content: 53 For this corruptible must needs clothe itself with incorruptibility, And this mortal､ clothe itself with immortality.
content_old: 53 For this corruptible must needs clothe itself with incorruptibility, And this mortal､ clothe itself with immortality.

content: 54 But whensoever this mortal shall clothe itself with immortality Then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written— Death hath been swallowed up victoriously;
content_old: 54 But whensoever this mortal shall clothe itself with immortality Then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written— Death hath been swallowed up victoriously;

content: 55 Where､ O death､ is thy victory? Where､ O death､ is thy sting?
content_old: 55 Where､ O death､ is thy victory? Where､ O death､ is thy sting?

content: 56 Now the sting of death is sin, And the power of sin is the law;—
content_old: 56 Now the sting of death is sin, And the power of sin is the law;—

content: 57 But unto God be thanks､ who is giving unto us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
content_old: 57 But unto God be thanks､ who is giving unto us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

content: 1 Now concerning the collection which is for the saints Just as I directed the assemblies of Galatia So also do ye:—
content_old: 1 Now concerning the collection which is for the saints Just as I directed the assemblies of Galatia So also do ye:—

content: 2 Upon the first of the week let each one of you put by itself､ in store as he may he prospering,— Lest as soon as I come then collections should be in progress.
content_old: 2 Upon the first of the week let each one of you put by itself､ in store as he may he prospering,— Lest as soon as I come then collections should be in progress.

content: 3 And as soon as I arrive whomsoever ye shall approve by letters these will I send､ to bear away your favour unto Jerusalem:
content_old: 3 And as soon as I arrive whomsoever ye shall approve by letters these will I send､ to bear away your favour unto Jerusalem:

content: 4 And if it be meet that I also be journeying with me shall they journey.
content_old: 4 And if it be meet that I also be journeying with me shall they journey.

content: 5 Now I will come unto you､ as soon as I have passed through Macedonia,— For I do pass through Macedonia:
content_old: 5 Now I will come unto you､ as soon as I have passed through Macedonia,— For I do pass through Macedonia:

content: 6 And with you I may perhaps sojourn､ or winter,— That ye may set me forward whither-soever I may be journeying.
content_old: 6 And with you I may perhaps sojourn､ or winter,— That ye may set me forward whither-soever I may be journeying.

content: 7 For I do not wish to see you､ just now､ by the way; For I hope to remain some time with you,— If the Lord permit.
content_old: 7 For I do not wish to see you､ just now､ by the way; For I hope to remain some time with you,— If the Lord permit.

content: 8 But I remain in Ephesus､ until the Pentecost,
content_old: 8 But I remain in Ephesus､ until the Pentecost,

content: 9 For a door､ unto me hath opened great and effectual and opposers are many.
content_old: 9 For a door､ unto me hath opened great and effectual and opposers are many.

content: 10 But if Timothy should come See that without fear he be with you, For in the work of the Lord doth he labour､ even as I:
content_old: 10 But if Timothy should come See that without fear he be with you, For in the work of the Lord doth he labour､ even as I:

content: 11 Let no one then despise him; And set ye him forward in peace､ that he may come unto me, For I expect him with the brethren.
content_old: 11 Let no one then despise him; And set ye him forward in peace､ that he may come unto me, For I expect him with the brethren.

content: 12 But concerning Apollos the brother Much did I beseech him､ that he would come unto you with the brethren, But there was by no means any will､ that he should come now;— He will come､ however､ as soon as he hath good opportunity.
content_old: 12 But concerning Apollos the brother Much did I beseech him､ that he would come unto you with the brethren, But there was by no means any will､ that he should come now;— He will come､ however､ as soon as he hath good opportunity.

content: 13 Be on the watch､ Stand firm in the faith, Be men,— Be strong;
content_old: 13 Be on the watch､ Stand firm in the faith, Be men,— Be strong;

content: 14 Let all your affairs in love be carried on.
content_old: 14 Let all your affairs in love be carried on.

content: 15 Now I beseech you､ brethren,— Ye know the house of Stephanas､ that it is a first-fruit of Achaia, and for the purpose of ministering they devoted themselves unto the saints—
content_old: 15 Now I beseech you､ brethren,— Ye know the house of Stephanas､ that it is a first-fruit of Achaia, and for the purpose of ministering they devoted themselves unto the saints—

content: 16 That ye also be submitting yourselves unto such as these,—and unto everyone helping in the work and toiling.
content_old: 16 That ye also be submitting yourselves unto such as these,—and unto everyone helping in the work and toiling.

content: 17 I rejoice､ moreover､ in the presence of Stephanas､ and Fortunatus, and Achaicus: Because your own shortcoming these have filled up:—
content_old: 17 I rejoice､ moreover､ in the presence of Stephanas､ and Fortunatus, and Achaicus: Because your own shortcoming these have filled up:—

content: 18 They have given rest､ in fact､ unto my spirit and yours: Hold in acknowledgment､ therefore､ such as these.
content_old: 18 They have given rest､ in fact､ unto my spirit and yours: Hold in acknowledgment､ therefore､ such as these.

content: 19 The assemblies of Asia salute you: Aquila and Priscilla､ with the assembly meeting at their house､ salute you much in the Lord:
content_old: 19 The assemblies of Asia salute you: Aquila and Priscilla､ with the assembly meeting at their house､ salute you much in the Lord:

content: 20 All the brethren salute you:— Salute ye one another with a holy kiss.
content_old: 20 All the brethren salute you:— Salute ye one another with a holy kiss.

content: 21 The salutation of Paul—with my own hand.
content_old: 21 The salutation of Paul—with my own hand.

content: 22 If anyone doth not dearly love the Lord Let him be anathema that is, “accursed”: Maran atha that is, “The Lord cometh,”.
content_old: 22 If anyone doth not dearly love the Lord Let him be anathema that is, “accursed”: Maran atha that is, “The Lord cometh,”.

content: 23 The favour of the Lord Jesus be with you.
content_old: 23 The favour of the Lord Jesus be with you.
